creator: olaf@xcc.tmfweb.nl
text:
After installing Apache the "Control Apache Server" menu only contains "Start 
Apache in Console" and "Monitor Apache Servers". The restart and shutdown 
options (from previous versions) are not present.

I installed Apache on a per-user basis. I only changed DocumentRoot and Listen 
(from 8080 to 80).

Another problem with the MSI installer is that if I ask it to install Apache as 
a service for all users on port 80, it's actually installed as a service on 
port 8080.
creator: olaf@xcc.tmfweb.nl
wrowe@apache.org
text:
This is actually correct.  Per-user is the exception [not recommended].

  To stop Apache in a console, you simply press ctrl+c or click the close
  box for the Apache console window.  [Use only Ctrl+C in Win9x or WinME,
  the close button issue isn't resolved for those broken consoles yet.]

  To restart, you would simply start the server again.

  Apache 'as a user' isn't meant for production servers.  That is what
  services offer.

About your additional report, I'm guessing you didn't wipe out the existing
  httpd.conf.  The installer won't overwrite or wipe out your old httpd.conf file.
